provides all the needed APIs to control your Ingenico device (iSMP, iSMP Companion and iCMP)

Detailed Description

Companion Configuration Functions.

Function Documentation

- (iSMPResult) eraseEncryptionKey

Erases an encryption key loaded into the terminal.

This method removes an encryption key previously downloaded into the Companion through calling updateEncryptionKeyWithServerIP or updateEncryptionKeyWithServerByHostName.

Returns
A return code constant defined within the eISMPResult enumeration. ISMP_Result_SUCCESS is returned if the call succeeds.
- (NSDate *) getDate

Get the system date and time of the Companion module.

This method is synchronous and may be time consuming depending on the load of the Companion

Returns
A NSDate containing the current date of the Companion
- (NSString*) getFullSerialNumber

Ask the Companion module for its full serial number.

When the getFullSerialNumber request fails due to a timeout, the return is set to "NULL".

Returns
A NSString containing the full serial number of the Companion
- (ICDeviceInformation) getInformation

Ask the Companion module for its current serial number and reference code.

When the getInformation request fails due to a timeout, the integer data members of ICDeviceInformation are set to a negative value.

Returns
A ICDeviceInformation structure containing general information about the Companion
- (int) getPeripheralStatus: (iSMPPeripheral)  device

Ask the Companion module for the peripheral status.

The purpose of this message is to poll the Companion module to get the status of the peripheral connected on the SPP channel.

Returns
YES if the request succeeds, NO otherwise
Parameters
deviceAn enum indicating the link to return status
- (NSArray *) getSoftwareComponents

Get the terminal's software components information.

This method issues a synchronous message to retrieve the software components loaded into the terminal. It returns an array of ICSoftwareComponent objects. Each one of these objects has a name, version, type and CRC code. All binary types are enumerated within eICDeviceSoftwareComponentType

Returns
NSArray containing the components' file names.
- (NSString *) getSpmciVersion

Get the terminal's SPMCI component version.

This method issues a synchronous message to retrieve the software component version loaded into the terminal. It returns an NSString of ICSoftwareComponent objects.

Returns
NSString containing the SPMCI version file.
- (ICTmsInformation*) getTmsInformation

Get the TMS server parameters from the Companion.

This method is synchronous and may be time consuming depending on the load of the Companion

Returns
The parameters set in the terminal are returns in ICTmsInformation structure
- (BOOL) isIdle

Ask the Companion module for its state.

The purpose of this message is to poll the Companion module to get its state, and turn it off in case of inactivity.

Returns
YES if the Companion is idle, NO if it is busy
- (void) reset: (NSUInteger)  resetInfo

Reset the terminal.

This request asks the terminal to reboot.
The call to reset returns immediately and it has no effect when the terminal is disconnected.

Parameters
resetInfoA constant indicating the reason of the reset
- (BOOL) setDate

Set the system date and time of the Companion module.

The setDate request is applied by the Companion only if the difference between the iDevice and the Companion dates is less than 2 days

Returns
YES if the request succeeds, NO otherwise
- (BOOL) setServerConnectionState: (BOOL)  connectionState

Update the server connection state.

This method is used to inform the Companion on whether the iDevice is connected to a remote host. This will affect the icon on the Companion manager, that will display an established or a broken link.

Parameters
connectionStateThe connection state to a remote host. Put YES when connected, NO when disconnected.
Returns
YES if the operation succeeds, NO if it fails
- (iSMPResult) setTmsInformation: (ICTmsInformation *)  tmsInfos

Set the TMS server parameters.

The setTmsInformation request is used to write one or more parameters in the terminal using the ICTmsInformation structure

Returns
A return code constant defined within the eISMPResult enumeration. ISMP_Result_SUCCESS is returned if the call succeeds.
- (BOOL) simulateKey: (NSUInteger)  key

Simulate a key press on the terminal's keypad.

This command simulates a key press event on the terminal's keypad. It returns immediately and has no effect when the terminal is disconnected.

Parameters
keyThe key code (refer to eICDeviceKeys for all possible values)
Returns
YES if the command was successful, NO otherwise.
- (BOOL) startRemoteDownload

Start a remote download session on the Companion.

This method starts the remote download process that updates the software components of the Companion terminal from a remote server. The server's parameters (IP, Port, Logon) have to be configured on the terminal side.
A network connection is required for the download, and the Companion should be granted access to the network by properly initializing a ICPPP or ICNetwork object.
This function is blocking and returns as soon as the download is over, or when the 10-minuts timeout is reached. The terminal reboots just after that.

Returns
YES if the update is successful, NO if it failed.
- (iSMPResult) updateEncryptionKeyWithServerByHostName: (NSString *)  hostname
andPort: (NSUInteger)  port 

Update the terminal's encryption key by hostname.

This method is synchronous and takes time to return since it requires downloading an encryption key from a remote server. It should be performed in background to avoid freezing the main thread

Parameters
hostnameThe hostname address of the server from which the key might be downloaded
portThe port to which the key updater should connect
Returns
A return code constant defined within the eISMPResult enumeration. ISMP_Result_SUCCESS is returned if the call succeeds. The error codes are prefixed with ISMP_Result_KEY_INJECTION
- (iSMPResult) updateEncryptionKeyWithServerIP: (NSString *)  ip
andPort: (NSUInteger)  port 

Update the terminal's encryption key.

This method is synchronous and takes time to return since it requires downloading an encryption key from a remote server. It should be performed in background to avoid freezing the main thread

Parameters
ipThe IP address of the server from which the key might be downloaded
portThe port to which the key updater should connect
Returns
A return code constant defined within the eISMPResult enumeration. ISMP_Result_SUCCESS is returned if the call succeeds. The error codes are prefixed with ISMP_Result_KEY_INJECTION
- (iSMPResult) validateEncryptionKey

Check if the encryption key loaded into the terminal is valid.

This method checks if an encryption key previously downloaded into the Companion through calling updateEncryptionKeyWithServerIP or updateEncryptionKeyWithServerByHostName is present and valid.

Returns
A return code constant defined within the eISMPResult enumeration. ISMP_Result_SUCCESS is returned if the call succeeds.
